Note taking software like Joplin but with different UI?
text:
I'm trying to find a app for Ubuntu that has exactly same features as Joplin but different colors, and different UI. Because ik it's stupid to tell, but I'm getting negative vibes and it's not matching my energy when I use joplin but I love the joplin because it does everything that I want. Important features for me are: 1) Paste image (embed it so that you can see it instantly, wysiwyg) 2) Have multiple tabs support (vertical bar or horizontal bar doesn't matter). 3) Increase font by zooming with pinch touchpad movement. Or just have better font size choices. 4) Scrolling with mouse or touchpad should be smooth. (It's not smooth in trilium notes).

That's all I want, and I'm quite surprised it's so tough to find an app that does both in laptop. I tried zim which is probably most close to these features, but it weirdly changes the position of tabs when you click on it, it's annoying.

I'm using trillium notes but increasing font size isn't very possible here. There's a "pseudo-fix" to it, but it's lame. There's not even a font size choice in trilium notes.

So, can you suggest me any apps in ubuntu laptop?

I've tried all apps present in Ubunutu Software app.

![image|182x137](upload://dcapJoatzDOT9cejKGpARf5d3R2.png)

I've also asked it here in hackernews!

https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=32606983

But I can't use obsidian because it creates new tab(or new sth) for every pasted image. Sometimes, my notes are just images pasted with some texts in between, and it creates a havoc in obsidian. I'm not sure if that can be fixed in obsidian and I really don't understand the purpose of it.

I've read most askubuntu answers and still not satisfied with most. And yes, I've tried every apps that are present in ubuntu software store(that comes pre-installed with ubuntu by searching "note" and I downloaded every note application).

I don't need any encryption, syncing, backup, any thing at all except what I mentioned above. Because I don't write notes and study from laptop, I don't get anything that I write in laptop. What I instead do is to collect every information that I collect from various sources in 1 notes (or more than 1 as a chapter has various topics) and instantly within 2-3 hrs, I write everything back to my paper. I don't even need to save those notes.

Notepadd++ was doing great job except it could not add images. :(

I just tried typora, it's great but doesn't support tabs. Tell me if it does support it or if there is a way to make it support tabs.
